Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The Multicenter AIDS Cohort Study (MACS) is an ongoing prospective study of the natural and treated histories of HIV-1 infection in homosexual and bisexual men. MACS is led by Steven Wolinsky (Chicago), Charles Rinaldo and Jeremy Martinson (Pittsburgh), Roger Detels and Otoniel Martinez (Los Angeles), and Joseph Margolick and Todd Brown (Baltimore). Its Data Analysis Center is led by Lisa Jacobson and Amber D'Souza. The project described was supported by the National Institute on Drug Abuse (R01 DA033773). Funding for research by MACS was provided by the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (U01 AI035039, U01 AI035040, U01 AI035041, U01-AI35042, and UM1 AI035043).
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: IRB approval required. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of data is limited to non-profits. Use of data includes method development research. Genetic Studies of sexual orientation is prohibited.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (IRB, PUB, NPU, MDS, GSO)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-IRB-PUB-NPU-MDS-GSO
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms). Use of the data is limited to genetic studies only.
May not be used for genetic analysis of sexual orientation.
